Package ohos.location

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.location.Location

  • public class Location
extends Object
    Represents a data class that provides information about geographic locations.

    Information about the geographic location includes the latitude, longitude, moving speed, moving direction, and timestamp.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    Sequenceable
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Location#LOCATION

      Constructor Description
      Location​(double latitude, double longitude)
      Creates a new Location object based on the specified longitude and latitude.
      Location​(Location location)
      Creates a new Location object based on an original object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location​(Location location)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Location object based on an original object.
        Parameters:
        location - Specifies the original Location object. The value cannot be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the value of the Location object is null.
        Since:
        1

      • Location

        public Location​(double latitude,
                double longitude)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Location object based on the specified longitude and latitude.

        Except the longitude and latitude, use default value 0 for remaining data fields, including the accuracy, altitude, moving speed, moving direction, and timestamp.

        Parameters:
        latitude - Specifies the latitude. The value range is [-90,90], in unit of degrees.
        longitude - Specifies the longitude. The value range is [-180,180], in unit of degrees.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the latitude is not within the range [-90,90].
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the longitude is not within the range [-180,180].
        Since:
        1

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDistance

        public static float calculateDistance​(double startLatitude,
                                      double startLongitude,
                                      double endLatitude,
                                      double endLongitude)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Estimates the linear distance between two longitude and latitude coordinates, in unit of meters.
        Parameters:
        startLatitude - Specifies the latitude of the start point. The value range is [-90,90], in unit of degrees.
        startLongitude - Specifies the longitude of the start point. The value range is [-180,180], in unit of degrees.
        endLatitude - Specifies the latitude of the end point. The value range is [-90,90], in unit of degrees.
        endLongitude - Specifies the longitude of the end point. The value range is [-180,180], in unit of degrees.
        Returns:
        Returns the distance between two longitude and latitude coordinates.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the latitude is not within the range [-90,90].
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the longitude is not within the range [-180,180].
        Since:
        1

      • calculateBearing

        public static float calculateBearing​(double startLatitude,
                                     double startLongitude,
                                     double endLatitude,
                                     double endLongitude)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Estimates the azimuth between two longitude and latitude coordinates.
        Parameters:
        startLatitude - Indicates the latitude of the start position. The value range is [-90,90].
        startLongitude - Indicates the longitude of the start position. The value range is [-180,180].
        endLatitude - Indicates the latitude of the end position. The value range is [-90,90].
        endLongitude - Indicates the longitude of the end position. The value range is [-180,180].
        Returns:
        Returns the estimated azimuth between two longitude and latitude coordinates.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the latitude is out of range [-90,90] or the longitude is out of range [-180,180].
        Since:
        5

      • getAdditions

        public PacMap getAdditions​()
        Obtains extended information about a Location object.

        The extended information is stored in PacMap.

        Returns:
        Returns extended information about a Location object. The value is null if no valid data exists.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        PacMap

      • setAdditions

        public void setAdditions​(PacMap additions)
        Sets extended information about a Location object.
        Parameters:
        additions - Specifies the PacMap object for storing extended information.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        PacMap

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection​()
        Obtains the moving direction of the device at the current location, in unit of degrees.

        The moving direction indicates the azimuth for horizontal movement of the device at the current position.

        Returns:
        Returns the azimuth for horizontal movement of the device at the current location. The value range is [0.0,360.0). The default value 0.0 indicates no valid azimuth data.
        Since:
        1

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(double value)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the moving direction of the device at the current location, in unit of degrees.

        The moving direction indicates the azimuth for horizontal movement of the device at the current position.

        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the azimuth for horizontal movement of the device. The value range is [0.0,360.0).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the azimuth for horizontal movement is not within the range [0.0,360.0).
        Since:
        1

      • setTimeSinceBoot

        public void setTimeSinceBoot​(long value)
        Sets the actual time when the location is obtained, in unit of nanoseconds.

        The time is a relative value compared with the time when the device is switched on.

        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the time when the location is obtained. The value must be greater than 0.0. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid time data.
        Since:
        1

      • getTimeSinceBoot

        public long getTimeSinceBoot​()
        Obtains the actual time when the location is obtained, in unit of nanoseconds.

        The time obtained using Locator indicates the differencebetween the time when the Location object is generated and the time when the device is switched on.

        Returns:
        Returns the difference between the time when the Location object is generated and the time when the device is switched on. The value must be greater than or equal to 0. The default value 0 indicates that no valid time data.
        Since:
        1

      • getLatitude

        public double getLatitude​()
        Obtains the latitude of the device at the current location, in unit of degrees.

        The latitude obtained using Locator is based on the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid.

        Returns:
        Returns the latitude of the device. The value range is [-90.0,90.0]. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid latitude data.
        Since:
        1

      • setLatitude

        public void setLatitude​(double value)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the latitude, in unit of degrees.
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the latitude. The value range is [-90.0,90.0].
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the latitude is not within the range [-90.0,90.0].
        Since:
        1

      • getLongitude

        public double getLongitude​()
        Obtains the longitude of the device at the current location, in unit of degrees.

        The longitude obtained using Locator is based on the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid.

        Returns:
        Returns the longitude of the device. The value range is [-180.0,180.0]. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid longitude data.
        Since:
        1

      • setLongitude

        public void setLongitude​(double value)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the longitude, in unit of degrees.
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the longitude. The value range is [-180.0,180.0].
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the latitude is not within the range [-180.0,180.0].
        Since:
        1

      • getAltitude

        public double getAltitude​()

        Returns:
        value of altitude

      • setAltitude

        public void setAltitude​(double value)
        Sets the altitude, in unit of meters.
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the altitude.
        Since:
        1

      • getAccuracy

        public float getAccuracy​()
        Obtains the predicted horizontal accuracy of the device at the current location, in unit of meters.

        Assume that the predicted horizontal accuracy is equal to a radius of 68% probability. If you draw a circle with this radius centering at the latitude and longitude coordinate of the device, there will be a 68% probability that the actual location is within the circle.

        Returns:
        Returns the estimated horizontal accuracy. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid accuracy data.
        Since:
        1

      • setAccuracy

        public void setAccuracy​(float value)
        Sets the horizontal accuracy of the device at the current location, in unit of meters.

        Assume that the predicted horizontal accuracy is equal to a radius of 68% probability. If you draw a circle with this radius centering at the latitude and longitude coordinate of the device, there will be a 68% probability that the actual location is within the circle.

        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the horizontal accuracy. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid accuracy data.
        Since:
        1

      • getSpeed

        public float getSpeed​()
        Obtains the estimated moving speed of the device at the current location, in unit of meters/second.

        The moving speed is estimated with the ground as the reference.

        Returns:
        Returns the moving speed of the device at the current location. The value is greater than 0.0. The default value 0.0 indicates that no moving speed data is available for the current location or that the device is static.
        Since:
        1

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed​(float value)
        Sets the moving speed, in unit of meters/second.
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the moving speed of the device. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid moving speed data.
        Since:
        1

      • getTimeStamp

        public long getTimeStamp​()
        Obtains the actual timestamp when the location is obtained, in unit of milliseconds.

        The timestamp obtained using Locator indicates the Unix time (a relative time since January 1, 1970) when the Location object is generated.

        Returns:
        Returns the timestamp when the location is obtained. The value must be greater than or equal to 0. The default value 0 indicates that no valid timestamp.
        Since:
        1

      • setTimeStamp

        public void setTimeStamp​(long value)
        Sets the actual timestamp when the location is obtained, in unit of milliseconds.

        The timestamp is a relative time since January 1, 1970.

        Parameters:
        value - Specifies the timestamp when the location is obtained. The value must be greater than 0.0. The default value 0.0 indicates no valid timestamp.
        Since:
        1

      • unmarshalling

        public boolean unmarshalling​(Parcel in)
        Unmarshalls a Location object and updates its data.

        Unmarshalling of Location objects is implemented using Sequenceable.

        Parameters:
        in - Specifies the Parcel object for unmarshalling a GeoAddress object. The value must not be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if unmarshaling is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Parcel, Sequenceable

      • marshalling

        public boolean marshalling​(Parcel out)
        Marshalls a Location object into a parcel.

        Marshalling of Location objects is implemented using Sequenceable.

        Parameters:
        out - Specifies the Parcel object for marshalling a Location object. The value cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if marshaling is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Parcel, Sequenceable
